headline: Apple integrates Generative AI into iOS 18
text: Apple Inc. unveiled its latest operating system featuring deep integration of generative AI across Siri and Messages, aiming to catch up with competitors in the AI space.

headline: Microsoft reports surge in Azure cloud revenue
text: The tech giant Microsoft saw a 30% jump in cloud revenue, driven by enterprise adoption of its Copilot AI tools and data center expansion.

headline: Nvidia reveals Blackwell B200 GPU pricing
text: Jensen Huang announced that the new Blackwell AI chips will cost between $30,000 and $40,000, signaling continued dominance in the semiconductor market.

headline: Amazon expands Prime Air drone delivery to UK and Italy
text: Amazon.com Inc. is scaling its drone logistics program internationally, promising one-hour delivery for small packages in select European cities.

headline: Alphabet faces new antitrust lawsuit over ad tech
text: The Department of Justice has filed a suit against Google's parent company, Alphabet, alleging monopolistic practices in the digital advertising exchange market.

headline: Meta Platforms debuts cheaper Quest 3S headset
text: Mark Zuckerberg introduced a budget-friendly mixed reality headset to compete with Apple Vision Pro and capture the mass market for the metaverse.

headline: Tesla Cybertruck production hits 1000 units per week
text: Elon Musk confirmed that the Gigafactory in Texas has ramped up production of the electric pickup truck, aiming to clear the massive preorder backlog.

headline: Berkshire Hathaway cash pile reaches record $189 billion
text: Warren Buffett's conglomerate continues to sell stocks, including Apple, hoarding cash amidst what the Oracle of Omaha calls a 'casino-like' market environment.

headline: Eli Lilly's Zepbound shows promise for sleep apnea
text: New clinical trial data suggests that Eli Lilly's weight-loss drug also significantly reduces the severity of sleep apnea in obese patients.

headline: Broadcom completes integration of VMware
text: Semiconductor and software firm Broadcom has finalized its acquisition of VMware, announcing a shift to a subscription-based licensing model for cloud customers.

headline: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon warns of inflation stickiness
text: In his annual letter, the head of the largest US bank cautioned that interest rates might remain higher for longer due to persistent inflationary pressures.

headline: Visa and Mastercard agree to $30 billion settlement
text: The payment processors reached a landmark settlement with US merchants to lower swipe fees, potentially ending years of antitrust litigation.

headline: Exxon Mobil starts lithium production for EV batteries
text: The oil giant is diversifying into green energy by launching a lithium extraction pilot in Arkansas, aiming to supply electric vehicle manufacturers.

headline: Walmart launches premium food brand 'Bettergoods'
text: Retailer Walmart introduced its largest private-label food brand in two decades, targeting younger, affluent shoppers with chef-inspired products.

headline: UnitedHealth Group grapples with cyberattack fallout
text: The healthcare insurer is still recovering from the Change Healthcare hack, which disrupted payments to doctors and pharmacies nationwide.

headline: Procter & Gamble raises sales forecast despite price hikes
text: The maker of Tide and Pampers reported strong organic sales growth, proving that consumers remain loyal to big brands despite higher costs.

headline: Johnson & Johnson finalizes talc settlement proposal
text: J&J has proposed a $6.5 billion settlement to resolve thousands of lawsuits alleging its talc-based baby powder caused ovarian cancer.

headline: Home Depot acquires SRS Distribution for $18 billion
text: The home improvement retailer is making a massive bet on the professional contractor market by buying a leading roofing and building materials distributor.

headline: Merck's Keytruda sales top $25 billion
text: Pharmaceutical giant Merck reported record sales for its blockbuster cancer drug, cementing its status as the world's best-selling medicine.

headline: Costco cracks down on membership sharing
text: The warehouse club is testing scanners at entrances to ensure that only paying members are entering its stores, following Netflix's lead.

headline: Chevron acquires Hess Corporation for $53 billion
text: Chevron is doubling down on fossil fuels with a mega-merger that gives it a significant stake in the lucrative Guyana oil fields.

headline: AMD challenges Nvidia with MI300X AI accelerator
text: Lisa Su claims AMD's new chip outperforms Nvidia's H100 in certain inference workloads, securing orders from Meta and Microsoft.

headline: PepsiCo sees volume decline in North America
text: The beverage and snack giant reported a drop in sales volume as consumers push back against cumulative price increases on chips and sodas.

headline: Coca-Cola launches Spiced flavor to attract Gen Z
text: Coca-Cola introduced its first permanent flavor addition in years, blending raspberry and spiced notes to appeal to younger demographics.

headline: Adobe Firefly AI integrated into Photoshop workflow
text: Adobe has embedded its generative fill technology directly into Creative Cloud, accelerating adoption among professional designers.

headline: Salesforce lays off 700 employees in strategic pivot
text: The CRM leader continues to restructure its workforce to focus on AI-driven data cloud services, following pressure from activist investors.

headline: Netflix subscriber growth beats expectations on ad tier
text: The streaming service added 9 million subscribers in Q1, proving that its crackdown on password sharing and new ad-supported plan are working.

headline: Cisco completes $28 billion acquisition of Splunk
text: Networking giant Cisco is bolstering its cybersecurity and observability portfolio by acquiring data analytics firm Splunk.

headline: Accenture books $1.1 billion in GenAI revenue
text: The consulting firm reported a surge in demand for generative AI implementation services from Global 2000 clients.

headline: McDonald's tests automated drive-thrus with Google Cloud
text: The fast-food chain is partnering with Google to use generative AI for taking orders, aiming to reduce wait times and labor costs.

headline: Abbott Laboratories recalls heart pumps after FDA warning
text: Medical device maker Abbott is recalling nearly 14,000 heart pumps following reports of serious injuries, impacting its stock price.

headline: Intel foundry business reports $7 billion operating loss
text: CEO Pat Gelsinger disclosed heavy losses in the chip manufacturing division as Intel invests heavily to catch up with TSMC.

headline: Verizon lands $2 billion contract with US Navy
text: The telecom operator won a major government contract to provide 5G and voice services to Navy personnel and federal agencies.

headline: Comcast's Peacock streaming losses narrow
text: Media giant Comcast reported that its streaming service is nearing profitability, fueled by exclusive NFL games and hit movies like Oppenheimer.

headline: Pfizer launches cost-cutting program as Covid revenues vanish
text: The pharmaceutical company plans to cut $4 billion in costs to adjust to the post-pandemic decline in vaccine and Paxlovid sales.

headline: Nike warns of softer sales outlook in China
text: Sportswear giant Nike lowered its revenue guidance, citing macroeconomic headwinds and fierce competition from local brands in China.

headline: Disney wins proxy battle against Nelson Peltz
text: CEO Bob Iger secured a victory against activist investors who sought seats on the board to shake up the media conglomerate's strategy.

headline: Wells Fargo faces renewed scrutiny over fake accounts
text: Regulators are investigating whether the bank has fully fixed the internal controls issues that led to the scandalous sales practices of the past.

headline: General Electric completes split into three companies
text: The historic conglomerate has finalized its breakup, with GE Aerospace, GE Vernova, and GE HealthCare now trading as independent entities.

headline: Intuit introduces AI assistant for TurboTax
text: Financial software maker Intuit is rolling out a generative AI assistant to help users file taxes and manage finances more accurately.

headline: IBM unveils new quantum computing chip 'Heron'
text: IBM claims a breakthrough in error correction with its new quantum processor, moving closer to practical commercial applications.

headline: Caterpillar warns of slowing construction demand
text: The heavy equipment manufacturer signaled a slowdown in order activity from construction customers in Europe and China.

headline: Uber joins the S&P 500 index
text: Ride-hailing giant Uber Technologies was added to the benchmark index after reporting consistent profitability for the first time.

headline: Union Pacific navigates rail safety reforms
text: The railroad operator is implementing new safety technologies following pressure from regulators after a series of high-profile derailments.

headline: Boeing CEO to step down amid 737 Max crisis
text: Dave Calhoun announced his resignation as Boeing faces intense scrutiny over quality control issues and production delays.

headline: Goldman Sachs profit jumps on investment banking rebound
text: The investment bank reported a surge in dealmaking fees as M&A activity picks up after a quiet 2023.

headline: Philip Morris expands Zyn production in US
text: The tobacco company is investing $600 million to build a new factory in Colorado to meet booming demand for its nicotine pouches.

headline: Honeywell acquires Carrier's security business for $5 billion
text: Industrial conglomerate Honeywell is expanding its building automation division by buying the security access unit from Carrier Global.

headline: Morgan Stanley names Ted Pick as new CEO
text: The investment bank completed its leadership transition, with Ted Pick taking the helm from long-time CEO James Gorman.

headline: BlackRock assets under management hit record $10.5 trillion
text: The world's largest asset manager continues to attract capital into its ETFs, benefiting from the bull market in stocks.

headline: Micron Technology receives $6 billion CHIPS Act grant
text: The memory chip maker secured billions in federal funding to build semiconductor fabs in New York and Idaho, bolstering US domestic manufacturing.

headline: Target warns of rising retail theft impacting margins
text: Retailer Target Corp flagged 'shrinkage' due to organized retail crime as a major headwind, prompting store closures in select urban locations.

headline: American Express captures Gen Z spending share
text: Amex reported that Millennials and Gen Z are its fastest-growing customer segment, accounting for 60% of new card acquisitions globally.

headline: Amgen enters weight-loss drug race with MariTide
text: Biotech giant Amgen released promising Phase 2 data for its obesity injectable, aiming to challenge the duopoly of Eli Lilly and Novo Nordisk.

headline: UPS secures new labor contract, avoiding strike
text: United Parcel Service ratified a five-year deal with the Teamsters union, increasing wages for drivers but warning of short-term margin pressure.

headline: RTX Corp wins $1.2 billion missile defense contract
text: Defense contractor RTX (formerly Raytheon) was awarded a Pentagon contract to supply NASAMS air defense systems to Ukraine and other allies.

headline: ServiceNow integrates Generative AI into workflow platform
text: Software firm ServiceNow launched 'Now Assist', a suite of GenAI tools designed to automate IT support and HR tasks for enterprise clients.

headline: ConocoPhillips to acquire Marathon Oil for $22.5 billion
text: The energy sector consolidation continues as ConocoPhillips buys rival Marathon Oil in an all-stock deal to expand its US shale footprint.

headline: Mondelez raises prices as cocoa costs hit record highs
text: The maker of Oreo and Cadbury is hiking prices again to offset the historic surge in cocoa futures caused by supply shortages in West Africa.

headline: Ford delays EV production to focus on hybrids
text: Ford Motor Co is postponing the launch of its new electric SUV plant, pivoting strategy to ramp up hybrid vehicle production amidst slower EV adoption.

headline: Starbucks unveils 'Reinvention' plan to speed up service
text: The coffee chain is investing $450 million in new equipment like the 'Siren System' to reduce wait times and handle complex cold brew customizations.

headline: Deere & Co. bets on autonomous tractors
text: Agricultural giant John Deere is scaling up production of fully autonomous tillage tractors, leveraging AI to help farmers combat labor shortages.

headline: Lowe's cuts outlook citing pullback in DIY projects
text: Home improvement retailer Lowe's lowered its full-year guidance, noting that inflation-weary consumers are postponing big-ticket renovations.

headline: Palo Alto Networks introduces 'platformization' strategy
text: Cybersecurity leader Palo Alto Networks is offering free incentives to customers who switch to its unified platform, causing a temporary stock dip but aiming for long-term lock-in.

headline: Booking.com reports record summer travel bookings
text: Online travel agency Booking Holdings signaled a boom in European and Asian tourism, defying fears of a consumer spending recession.

headline: ADP data shows cooling US labor market
text: Payroll processor ADP reported private sector job growth is slowing down, fueling investor hopes that the Federal Reserve might cut interest rates soon.

headline: TJX Companies thrives as shoppers hunt for bargains
text: The parent company of TJ Maxx and Marshalls raised its profit forecast, benefiting from consumers trading down to off-price retailers.

headline: Progressive Insurance profits surge on higher premiums
text: Insurer Progressive reported a massive jump in net income after successfully raising auto insurance rates to cover rising repair costs.

headline: Vertex Pharmaceuticals gets FDA approval for non-opioid painkiller
text: Vertex achieved a major breakthrough with Casgevy, a gene therapy, and now sees success with a new class of pain medication that avoids addiction risks.

headline: Gilead Sciences expands oncology portfolio
text: Biopharma company Gilead is diversifying beyond HIV drugs by acquiring CymaBay Therapeutics to bolster its liver disease and cancer pipeline.

headline: McKesson agrees to opioid settlement payment structure
text: Drug distributor McKesson finalized the schedule for its portion of the nationwide opioid settlement, removing a long-standing legal overhang.

headline: Analog Devices warns of inventory glut in automotive chips
text: Semiconductor maker Analog Devices signaled a correction in the industrial and automotive markets as customers work through excess chip inventory.

headline: Chipotle tests avocado-peeling robot 'Autocado'
text: Fast-casual chain Chipotle Mexican Grill is piloting robotics to automate guacamole preparation and improve kitchen efficiency.

headline: Stryker acquires SERF SAS to expand joint replacement business
text: MedTech firm Stryker purchased the French joint replacement company to strengthen its foothold in the European hip implant market.

headline: Eaton Corp sees massive demand from AI data centers
text: Power management company Eaton is seeing a backlog of orders for transformers and switchgear needed to power energy-hungry AI server farms.

headline: CVS Health struggles with rising Medicare costs
text: Healthcare giant CVS cut its profit guidance, citing higher-than-expected utilization rates in its Medicare Advantage insurance business.

headline: Regeneron's high-dose Eylea gains market share
text: Biotech firm Regeneron reported strong uptake of its new high-dose version of the eye drug Eylea, fending off competition from biosimilars.

headline: Altria acquires NJOY to compete in e-cigarette market
text: Tobacco maker Altria bought vaping startup NJOY for $2.75 billion, making another attempt to pivot away from traditional cigarettes.

headline: Fiserv launches Clover Kiosk for restaurants
text: Fintech payment processor Fiserv rolled out self-service kiosks for its Clover point-of-sale system to help restaurants manage labor costs.

headline: Cigna sells Medicare business to HCSC
text: Health insurer Cigna agreed to sell its Medicare Advantage unit to Health Care Service Corp for $3.3 billion to focus on its pharmacy benefits arm, Evernorth.

headline: Southern Company completes Vogtle nuclear plant
text: Utility Southern Company finally brought Unit 4 of the Vogtle nuclear plant online, marking the first new US nuclear project built from scratch in decades.

headline: Waste Management invests in renewable natural gas
text: Trash hauler Waste Management is building facilities to capture methane from landfills and convert it into renewable fuel for its truck fleet.

headline: Sherwin-Williams raises prices amid housing slowdown
text: Paint manufacturer Sherwin-Williams is managing to grow margins through price increases despite a slowdown in existing home sales.

headline: Marsh & McLennan benefits from rising insurance rates
text: Insurance broker Marsh reported revenue growth as it earns higher commissions from the skyrocketing premiums charged by carriers.

headline: Blackstone raises $30 billion for real estate fund
text: Private equity giant Blackstone sees an opportunity to buy distressed commercial real estate assets as valuations bottom out.

headline: Boston Scientific gets nod for Farapulse AFib system
text: MedTech firm Boston Scientific received FDA approval for its pulsed field ablation system, a safer way to treat irregular heartbeats.

headline: PNC Financial buys loan portfolio from Signature Bank
text: Regional bank PNC acquired a $16 billion portfolio of capital commitment facilities from the failed Signature Bank at a discount.

headline: Equinix faces short-seller report alleging accounting manipulation
text: Data center REIT Equinix saw its stock fall after Hindenburg Research accused it of manipulating metrics, a claim the company vigorously denies.

headline: CSX rail volume impacted by coal decline
text: Railroad operator CSX reported flat revenues as a drop in domestic coal shipments offset gains in intermodal and automotive transport.

headline: Lam Research benefits from China chip equipment spending
text: Semiconductor equipment maker Lam Research reported strong sales to China as local fabs rush to buy tools before further US export restrictions.

headline: Norfolk Southern agrees to $600 million settlement for East Palestine
text: The rail operator agreed to a class-action settlement to resolve lawsuits related to the toxic train derailment in Ohio.

headline: Dominion Energy sells natural gas assets to Enbridge
text: Utility Dominion Energy sold its gas distribution companies to Enbridge to pay down debt and focus on its regulated electric utility business.

headline: Humana stock falls on higher medical loss ratio
text: Insurer Humana alarmed investors by disclosing a sharp rise in medical costs for older adults, impacting the entire managed care sector.

headline: Edwards Lifesciences spins off critical care unit
text: Medical device maker Edwards is selling its critical care monitoring business to BD (Becton, Dickinson) to focus purely on structural heart innovations.

headline: General Dynamics unveils new nuclear submarine
text: Defense contractor General Dynamics christened the USS New Jersey, the newest Virginia-class attack submarine for the US Navy.

headline: Marriott International expands luxury footprint in Asia
text: Hotel chain Marriott plans to open 30 new luxury hotels in the Asia-Pacific region, betting on the return of high-net-worth Chinese travelers.

headline: Moderna reports positive data for combo Flu-Covid vaccine
text: Biotech firm Moderna said its combination mRNA vaccine elicited a stronger immune response than separate shots in late-stage trials.

headline: Estée Lauder cuts workforce amid China weakness
text: Cosmetics giant Estée Lauder is slashing 3,000 jobs as part of a restructuring plan to cope with slumping sales in mainland China and travel retail.

headline: Occidental Petroleum receives backing for carbon capture hub
text: Energy firm Occidental secured government grants to develop a Direct Air Capture hub in Texas, a key pillar of its low-carbon strategy.

headline: Lululemon stock drops on weak guidance in North America
text: Athleisure brand Lululemon warned of slowing growth in the US market as consumers become more selective with discretionary apparel spending.

headline: KLA Corporation benefits from advanced chip packaging demand
text: Semiconductor equipment maker KLA Corp reported strong orders for its process control tools, driven by the shift to complex 3D chip packaging techniques.

headline: Charles Schwab reports $45 billion in net new assets
text: Despite banking sector turbulence, brokerage giant Charles Schwab attracted significant inflows of client cash, calming fears about cash sorting.

headline: Prologis warns of cooling warehouse demand
text: Industrial REIT Prologis noted that logistics customers are taking longer to make leasing decisions, signaling a normalization after the pandemic e-commerce boom.

headline: Kraft Heinz faces scrutiny over Lunchables sodium levels
text: Consumer advocacy groups are pressuring Kraft Heinz to reformulate its popular Lunchables kits after reports of high lead and sodium content.

headline: American Tower expands edge data center portfolio
text: Cell tower REIT American Tower is converting ground space at tower sites into mini data centers to support low-latency 5G applications.

headline: HCA Healthcare solves staffing shortages, margins improve
text: Hospital operator HCA Healthcare reported that reliance on expensive contract labor has plummeted, significantly boosting its operating margins.

headline: General Mills sees growth in Blue Buffalo pet food
text: While human food sales flattened, General Mills reported double-digit growth in its Blue Buffalo pet segment, proving Americans still splurge on their pets.

headline: Moody's integrates Microsoft Copilot for risk analysis
text: Credit rating agency Moody's is rolling out a custom AI tool built on Microsoft Azure to help analysts search through mountains of financial documents.

headline: Carrier Global sees heat pump boom in Europe
text: HVAC manufacturer Carrier reported record sales of heat pumps in Europe as the continent shifts away from gas boilers for residential heating.

headline: Autodesk acquires Payapps to bolster construction cloud
text: Software firm Autodesk bought construction payment management platform Payapps to strengthen its 'Construction Cloud' offering for contractors.

headline: General Motors delays electric truck plant production
text: GM is pushing back the opening of its Orion Assembly electric truck plant by a year to better align production with evolving EV demand.

headline: IQVIA expands decentralized clinical trial capabilities
text: Healthcare data firm IQVIA is launching new tools to allow patients to participate in drug trials remotely, increasing diversity in medical research.

headline: Trane Technologies beats earnings on commercial HVAC demand
text: Trane reported strong results driven by demand for energy-efficient chillers from data centers and commercial buildings looking to cut carbon emissions.

headline: S&P Global launches new sustainability sustainability sustainability scores
text: Financial data provider S&P Global introduced updated ESG scores to comply with stricter European reporting regulations.

headline: Citigroup plans to cut 20,000 jobs in restructuring
text: CEO Jane Fraser announced a massive overhaul of the bank's structure, eliminating management layers and reducing headcount to boost efficiency.

headline: Hershey warns of cocoa price impact on Halloween earnings
text: Chocolate maker The Hershey Company signaled that record-high cocoa prices will force it to raise prices or shrink package sizes for the holiday season.

headline: IDEXX Laboratories thrives on veterinary diagnostics
text: Pet healthcare firm IDEXX reported strong recurring revenue from vet clinics using its in-house blood testing analyzers.

headline: Parker-Hannifin benefits from aerospace supply chain recovery
text: Motion control company Parker-Hannifin raised its guidance, citing a long backlog of orders from commercial aircraft manufacturers like Boeing and Airbus.

headline: Duke Energy sells commercial renewables business
text: Utility Duke Energy completed the sale of its unregulated wind and solar assets to Brookfield, focusing fully on its regulated grid operations.

headline: Synopsys announces merger with Ansys
text: Chip design software leader Synopsys agreed to acquire simulation giant Ansys for $35 billion, creating a powerhouse in silicon systems design.

headline: Chubb warns of rising cyber insurance claims
text: Insurer Chubb Ltd noted an uptick in ransomware attacks, leading to higher payouts and signaling likely premium increases for businesses.

headline: Fastenal expands onsite vending machine network
text: Industrial distributor Fastenal installed a record number of industrial vending machines at customer sites, deepening its stickiness in the supply chain.

headline: Keurig Dr Pepper faces antitrust lawsuit over K-Cups
text: Keurig Dr Pepper agreed to pay a penalty to resolve claims that it unfairly monopolized the single-serve coffee pod market.

headline: Simon Property Group sees mall occupancy return to pre-pandemic levels
text: Mall operator Simon Property Group reported that high-end retailers are expanding their physical footprint, defying the 'retail apocalypse' narrative.

headline: Electronic Arts rebrands FIFA to FC 24 with success
text: Video game publisher EA reported that its rebranded soccer game, FC 24, exceeded sales expectations despite losing the FIFA licensing name.

headline: TransDigm buys aircraft components maker for $1.3 billion
text: Aerospace supplier TransDigm continues its acquisition spree, buying a specialized valve manufacturer to expand its high-margin aftermarket business.

headline: Zoetis launches Librela for canine arthritis
text: Animal health leader Zoetis is seeing rapid adoption of Librela, a monoclonal antibody injection for osteoarthritis pain in dogs.

headline: Cintas hits all-time high on uniform rental demand
text: Cintas Corp reported that labor shortages are driving companies to outsource uniform and facility services, boosting its recurring revenue.

headline: CoStar Group spends big on Super Bowl ads for Homes.com
text: Real estate data firm CoStar is investing aggressively in marketing to position its residential portal, Homes.com, as a rival to Zillow.

headline: Monster Beverage faces stiff competition from Celsius
text: Energy drink giant Monster reported slowing growth in the US as health-conscious consumers shift toward fitness drink rival Celsius Holdings.

headline: CME Group reports record bitcoin futures volume
text: Derivatives marketplace CME Group saw a surge in crypto trading activity following the SEC approval of spot Bitcoin ETFs.

headline: Amphenol acquires sensor maker for $2 billion
text: Electronics connector manufacturer Amphenol is expanding its sensor portfolio to serve the growing electric vehicle and industrial automation markets.

headline: Hilton partners with Small Luxury Hotels of the World
text: Hilton Worldwide is adding hundreds of boutique luxury hotels to its booking platform to compete with Marriott's luxury portfolio.

headline: Public Storage rolls out digital smart access locks
text: Self-storage REIT Public Storage is upgrading its facilities with app-enabled locks, allowing customers to rent and access units completely contact-free.

headline: Rockwell Automation lowers guidance on weak China manufacturing
text: Industrial automation firm Rockwell cut its outlook, citing a sharper-than-expected slowdown in factory spending in the Chinese market.

headline: Dexcom launches over-the-counter glucose monitor 'Stelo'
text: Medical device maker Dexcom received FDA clearance for Stelo, a biosensor for people with pre-diabetes who do not use insulin.

headline: Fair Isaac (FICO) raises prices on credit scores
text: FICO is leveraging its pricing power by increasing the cost of credit scores charged to mortgage lenders, boosting its high-margin software business.

headline: W.W. Grainger sees shift to B2B e-commerce
text: Industrial supplier Grainger reported that over 80% of its orders now originate through digital channels, improving operational efficiency.

headline: Aon acquires NFP for $13.4 billion
text: Insurance broker Aon is expanding into the middle-market segment by acquiring NFP, a leading benefits and wealth management consultancy.

headline: Cadence Design Systems unveils AI supercomputer design tools
text: Cadence introduced new software specifically optimized for designing the complex 3D structures of next-generation AI hardware.

headline: O'Reilly Automotive benefits from aging vehicle fleet
text: Auto parts retailer O'Reilly reported resilient sales as consumers hold onto their cars longer, requiring more maintenance and repairs.

headline: Republic Services opens first polymer recycling center
text: Waste management firm Republic Services opened a facility in Las Vegas dedicated to turning plastic bottles into food-grade recycled material.

headline: Old Dominion Freight Line defends pricing discipline
text: Trucking company Old Dominion refused to lower rates despite a freight recession, prioritizing profitability over volume market share.

headline: Gartner predicts AI consulting boom
text: IT research firm Gartner raised its revenue forecast, noting that every Fortune 500 company is seeking advice on generative AI strategy.

headline: Verisk Analytics expands climate risk modeling
text: Data analytics firm Verisk launched new tools to help insurers predict losses from wildfires and severe convective storms.

headline: Copart expands into heavy equipment auctions
text: Salvage auction leader Copart is growing its business of auctioning damaged construction and agriculture equipment online.

headline: McCormick & Co restores margins as inflation eases
text: Spice maker McCormick reported improved profitability as it finally catches up with input cost inflation through price hikes.

headline: Fortinet warns of spending slowdown in firewall market
text: Cybersecurity firm Fortinet saw its stock drop after reporting that hardware firewall sales are slowing as customers digest previous purchases.

headline: Arthur J. Gallagher acquires 15 small brokers in Q1
text: Insurance broker Arthur J. Gallagher continues its rollup strategy, acquiring smaller regional agencies to expand its distribution network.

headline: Otis Worldwide introduces Gen3 Core elevator
text: Elevator manufacturer Otis launched a new connected elevator specifically designed for the massive affordable housing market.

headline: West Pharmaceutical Services expands injectable packaging capacity
text: West Pharma is investing $350 million to expand its manufacturing sites in Ireland and Pennsylvania to meet surging demand for GLP-1 drug delivery systems.

headline: Ameriprise Financial declares dividend increase
text: Financial services firm Ameriprise raised its quarterly dividend by 10%, reflecting strong cash generation from its wealth management and advice business.

headline: Cummins launches fuel-agnostic engine platform
text: Engine maker Cummins introduced a new powertrain that can run on diesel, natural gas, or hydrogen, helping fleets transition to lower carbon fuels.

headline: United Rentals sees infrastructure bill tailwinds
text: Equipment rental giant United Rentals reported record utilization rates, citing a boom in mega-projects funded by the US Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act.

headline: Constellation Brands beer sales outperform wine and spirits
text: The owner of Modelo and Corona reported that its beer business continues to capture market share, while its wine division struggles with shifting consumer tastes.

headline: Paychex introduces AI-driven retention insights
text: HR software provider Paychex launched a new feature that uses predictive analytics to help small businesses identify employees at risk of leaving.

headline: Kellanova spins off North American cereal business
text: The company formerly known as Kellogg completed its separation into two entities, with Kellanova focusing on high-growth snacks like Pringles and Pop-Tarts.

headline: MSCI launches climate action index
text: Financial index provider MSCI rolled out a new suite of indices designed for investors who want to support companies with credible decarbonization targets.

headline: Motorola Solutions acquires IP from energetic materials firm
text: Motorola Solutions bought specialized technology to enhance its portfolio of safety and surveillance equipment for law enforcement agencies.

headline: Nucor builds new micro-mill in West Virginia
text: Steelmaker Nucor is constructing a sustainable steel mill powered by renewable energy, aiming to serve the automotive and construction markets in the Midwest.

headline: Realty Income closes $9 billion VEREIT merger
text: 'The Monthly Dividend Company', Realty Income, completed its acquisition of VEREIT, solidifying its position as the largest net lease REIT in the industry.

headline: Ross Stores plans 100 new locations in 2024
text: Off-price retailer Ross Stores is accelerating its brick-and-mortar expansion, seeing opportunity in markets where department stores are closing.

headline: Sysco acquires Edward Don & Company
text: Food distributor Sysco bought a leading distributor of foodservice equipment and supplies to broaden its offering to restaurant operators.

headline: T. Rowe Price launches new active ETFs
text: Asset manager T. Rowe Price is expanding its exchange-traded fund lineup, bringing its active management strategies to the ETF wrapper to stem outflows.

headline: Tractor Supply Company bets on 'Life Out Here' strategy
text: Rural lifestyle retailer Tractor Supply is remodeling stores to include garden centers and pet wash stations, deepening loyalty with hobby farmers.

headline: VeriSign renews .com registry agreement
text: VeriSign secured an extension of its exclusive right to operate the .com internet registry, ensuring a stable stream of high-margin revenue.

headline: Vulcan Materials raises prices on aggregates
text: Construction materials producer Vulcan Materials reported margin expansion after successfully passing through price hikes on crushed stone and gravel.

headline: Weyerhaeuser enters forest carbon market
text: Timber REIT Weyerhaeuser signed its first agreement to sell carbon credits generated from its millions of acres of sustainably managed timberlands.

headline: Yum! Brands aims for 100% digital sales mix
text: The parent company of KFC, Taco Bell, and Pizza Hut is deploying AI-powered kiosks and app-ordering globally to drive efficiency and ticket size.

headline: Zimmer Biomet unveils Persona IQ smart knee
text: MedTech firm Zimmer Biomet launched the world's first smart knee implant that captures data on range of motion and step count for post-surgery recovery.

headline: 3M settles PFAS litigation for $10.3 billion
text: Industrial giant 3M agreed to a multi-billion dollar settlement to resolve claims from public water providers regarding 'forever chemicals' contamination.

headline: Aflac expands dental and vision insurance offerings
text: Insurer Aflac is diversifying beyond its core supplemental cancer coverage by acquiring a dental network to offer comprehensive benefits packages.

headline: Agilent Technologies opens new life science hub in Singapore
text: Lab equipment maker Agilent expanded its manufacturing footprint in Asia to serve the growing pharmaceutical and clinical research markets there.

headline: Allstate raises auto rates to combat claims inflation
text: Insurer Allstate is aggressively hiking premiums in California and New York to offset the rising cost of repairing sophisticated modern vehicles.

headline: AMETEK acquires medical component manufacturer
text: Industrial conglomerate AMETEK bought a specialized maker of precision medical interconnects, continuing its strategy of acquiring niche technology leaders.

headline: APA Corp finds significant oil reserves in Suriname
text: Oil explorer APA Corp announced a major discovery offshore Suriname, potentially opening a new production frontier next to Exxon's Guyana success.

headline: Aptiv unveils next-gen ADAS platform
text: Auto tech supplier Aptiv revealed a new centralized computing platform that lowers the cost of implementing advanced driver-assistance systems for mass-market cars.

headline: Archer Daniels Midland faces accounting probe
text: Agribusiness giant ADM placed its CFO on leave pending an investigation into accounting practices in its Nutrition segment, causing a stock sell-off.

headline: Arista Networks gains share in enterprise campus switching
text: Networking firm Arista is taking market share from Cisco in the enterprise campus market with its cloud-native software approach.

headline: Assurant partners with major carrier for device trade-ins
text: Insurer Assurant secured a multi-year deal to manage the smartphone trade-in and upgrade program for a top US wireless carrier.

headline: AutoZone authorizes additional $1.5 billion buyback
text: Auto parts retailer AutoZone continues its aggressive capital return strategy, authorizing more share repurchases as DIY sales remain resilient.

headline: AvalonBay Communities focuses on Sun Belt expansion
text: Apartment REIT AvalonBay is selling older assets in coastal markets to fund the development of new luxury communities in Texas and Florida.

headline: Avery Dennison develops RFID for food waste reduction
text: Materials science firm Avery Dennison launched digital ID tags for perishable foods to help grocers manage expiration dates and reduce waste.

headline: Baker Hughes lands major LNG equipment order
text: Oilfield services firm Baker Hughes was awarded a contract to supply gas turbines and compressors for a massive new LNG export terminal in Qatar.

headline: Ball Corp sells aerospace division to BAE Systems
text: Packaging giant Ball Corp sold its aerospace unit for $5.6 billion to pay down debt and focus entirely on its aluminum beverage can business.

headline: BNY Mellon launches AI hub for wealth management
text: Bank of New York Mellon introduced an AI platform to help wealth managers analyze client portfolios and generate personalized investment insights.

headline: Bath & Body Works revamps loyalty program
text: The retailer relaunched its rewards program to drive engagement, offering earlier access to new candles and personalized scent recommendations.

headline: Baxter International spins off kidney care unit Vantive
text: Medical device maker Baxter plans to separate its kidney care segment into an independent public company named Vantive to unlock value.

headline: Becton Dickinson receives FDA clearance for new biopsy tool
text: BD secured approval for a new minimally invasive biopsy device that improves the accuracy of diagnosing breast cancer.

headline: Best Buy tests small-format digital-first stores
text: Electronics retailer Best Buy is opening smaller stores focused on pick-up and browsing, reducing square footage as sales shift online.

headline: Biogen acquires Reata Pharmaceuticals for $7.3 billion
text: Biotech firm Biogen bought Reata to add a newly approved treatment for a rare genetic neuromuscular disorder to its rare disease portfolio.

headline: Bio-Rad Laboratories settles royalty dispute with 10X Genomics
text: Life sciences firm Bio-Rad reached a global settlement regarding patent litigation over single-cell analysis technology.

headline: Bio-Techne opens new reagent manufacturing facility
text: Bio-Techne expanded its capacity to produce proteins and antibodies needed for the booming cell and gene therapy industry.

headline: BorgWarner completes spin-off of Phinia
text: Auto supplier BorgWarner spun off its fuel systems and aftermarket business into a new company, Phinia, to focus solely on electric vehicle tech.

headline: Brown-Forman faces headwinds from European tariffs
text: The maker of Jack Daniel's warned that retaliatory tariffs in the EU and slowing whiskey demand are weighing on its international growth.

headline: Builders FirstSource adopts AI for lumber estimation
text: Building supplier Builders FirstSource is using AI tools to automatically generate lumber take-offs from digital blueprints, speeding up quotes for homebuilders.

headline: Cadence Design Systems partners with Arm on chip design
text: Cadence and Arm expanded their collaboration to optimize design tools for Arm's latest Neoverse compute subsystems for data centers.

headline: Caesars Entertainment launches new sports betting app features
text: Casino operator Caesars upgraded its mobile sportsbook with faster live betting and more personalization to gain share in the iGaming market.

headline: Campbell Soup completes acquisition of Sovos Brands
text: Campbell Soup closed the $2.7 billion deal to buy the parent company of Rao's Homemade pasta sauce, boosting its premium food portfolio.

headline: Capital One to acquire Discover Financial for $35 billion
text: In a blockbuster deal, Capital One agreed to buy credit card issuer Discover, potentially creating a new payments giant to rival Visa and Mastercard.

headline: Cardinal Health renews massive pharmaceutical distribution deal
text: Drug distributor Cardinal Health extended its contract with CVS Health, securing its position as a primary supplier for one of the nation's largest pharmacy chains.

headline: CarMax rolls out new omnichannel buying experience
text: Used car retailer CarMax is integrating its online and in-store appraisal tools to streamline the trade-in process as the pre-owned vehicle market normalizes.

headline: Carnival Corp reports record bookings for 2025 cruises
text: Cruise operator Carnival said wave season demand has exceeded pre-pandemic levels, allowing it to raise prices across its Carnival, Princess, and Holland America lines.

headline: CBRE Group sees uptick in office leasing activity
text: Real estate services giant CBRE reported a surprise increase in commercial leasing in prime urban centers, suggesting a 'flight to quality' among corporate tenants.

headline: CDW expands partnership with Dell Technologies
text: IT solutions provider CDW is deepening its ties with Dell to offer enhanced hybrid cloud bundles to small and medium-sized business customers.

headline: Celanese acquires mobility materials business
text: Chemical maker Celanese completed the integration of DuPont's mobility and materials unit, aiming to capitalize on the shift to lighter-weight electric vehicles.

headline: Centene wins Medicaid contracts in three new states
text: Managed care insurer Centene secured major government contracts to administer Medicaid benefits, boosting its membership outlook for the next fiscal year.

headline: C.H. Robinson implements AI for freight pricing
text: Logistics broker C.H. Robinson launched a generative AI tool that predicts spot freight rates with higher accuracy, improving margins in a volatile shipping market.

headline: Charter Communications loses internet subscribers to fixed wireless
text: Spectrum parent Charter reported a dip in broadband users as competition intensifies from T-Mobile and Verizon's 5G home internet offerings.

headline: Church & Dwight acquires Hero Cosmetics
text: The owner of Arm & Hammer bought the maker of Mighty Patch acne stickers for $630 million, targeting younger consumers in the skincare category.

headline: Cincinnati Financial raises premiums to offset storm losses
text: Insurer Cincinnati Financial is hiking rates for property coverage after a year of record catastrophe losses from severe convective storms in the Midwest.

headline: Clorox fully recovers from cyberattack disruptions
text: Cleaning products maker Clorox confirmed that its supply chain and manufacturing operations have returned to full capacity following a damaging cyberattack last year.

headline: CMS Energy gets approval for solar expansion in Michigan
text: Utility CMS Energy received regulatory green light to add 300 megawatts of solar capacity as part of its plan to retire coal plants by 2025.

headline: Cognizant modernizes legacy systems for major insurer
text: IT services firm Cognizant won a multi-year deal to migrate a global insurance company's mainframe applications to the AWS cloud.

headline: Colgate-Palmolive sees growth in Latin America
text: Consumer goods giant Colgate reported double-digit organic sales growth in Brazil and Mexico, driven by pricing power in toothpaste and pet nutrition.

headline: Comerica refocuses on small business lending
text: Regional bank Comerica is shifting resources to expand its credit offerings for small businesses in Texas and California to diversify its loan book.

headline: Conagra Brands launches new healthy frozen meal line
text: Food company Conagra introduced a new range of high-protein, low-carb frozen bowls under its Healthy Choice brand to meet evolving dietary trends.

headline: Consolidated Edison invests in grid modernization
text: New York utility Con Ed is spending $2 billion to upgrade its transmission lines to handle the influx of renewable energy from offshore wind projects.

headline: Cooper Companies gets FDA nod for myopia control lens
text: Medical device maker CooperVision received approval for a new contact lens designed to slow the progression of nearsightedness in children.

headline: Corning secures funding for US fiber optic manufacturing
text: Glass maker Corning was awarded government grants to expand its domestic production of optical fiber, critical for the national broadband rollout.

headline: Corteva Agriscience launches new herbicide for soy farmers
text: Ag-chem leader Corteva introduced a new crop protection product that helps soybean farmers combat resistant weeds without damaging yields.

headline: Coterra Energy increases dividend on strong natural gas flows
text: Oil and gas producer Coterra raised its base dividend, citing operational efficiencies in the Marcellus and Permian basins.

headline: Crown Castle initiates strategic review of fiber business
text: Cell tower REIT Crown Castle is exploring a sale of its fiber optic unit to focus exclusively on its core tower leasing operations.

headline: Danaher completes spin-off of Veralto
text: Life sciences giant Danaher finalized the separation of its water quality and product identification businesses into a new public company, Veralto.

headline: Darden Restaurants acquires Ruth's Chris Steak House
text: Olive Garden parent Darden completed the $715 million acquisition of the fine dining chain, adding another high-margin brand to its portfolio.

headline: DaVita expands kidney care operations in Latin America
text: Dialysis provider DaVita acquired a network of clinics in Brazil and Colombia, continuing its international expansion strategy.

headline: Deckers Outdoor stock hits record high on HOKA sales
text: Footwear maker Deckers reported explosive growth for its HOKA running shoe brand, which is taking market share from Nike and Adidas.

headline: Delta Air Lines restores dividend suspended during pandemic
text: Delta became the first major US carrier to reinstate its quarterly dividend, signaling confidence in the long-term recovery of business travel.

headline: Devon Energy prioritizes share buybacks over production growth
text: Shale driller Devon Energy maintained a flat production outlook, choosing to return free cash flow to shareholders rather than drill new wells.

headline: Diamondback Energy merges with Endeavor in $26 billion deal
text: Oil producer Diamondback agreed to buy privately held Endeavor Energy Resources, creating the largest pure-play operator in the Permian Basin.

headline: Digital Realty forms joint venture for Indian data centers
text: Data center REIT Digital Realty partnered with Brookfield to develop critical infrastructure in India to support the country's booming digital economy.

headline: Dollar General plans 800 new store openings
text: Discount retailer Dollar General is aggressively expanding its rural footprint, targeting food deserts with more grocery options.

headline: Dollar Tree to close 1,000 underperforming Family Dollar stores
text: Retailer Dollar Tree announced a massive restructuring, shuttering unprofitable Family Dollar locations to improve overall margins.

headline: Dover Corp spins off environmental solutions business
text: Industrial manufacturer Dover plans to separate its waste handling and recycling equipment unit to focus on pumps and engineering systems.

headline: Dow Inc. collaborates on nuclear energy for chemical plants
text: Chemical giant Dow signed an agreement to deploy small modular nuclear reactors (SMRs) to decarbonize its manufacturing site in Texas.

headline: D.R. Horton sees surge in new home orders
text: America's largest homebuilder reported a jump in sales, using mortgage rate buydowns to attract buyers despite high interest rates.

headline: DTE Energy retires massive coal plant
text: Detroit-based utility DTE Energy shut down the Trenton Channel Power Plant as part of its accelerated transition to wind and solar generation.

headline: DuPont acquires medical components maker Donatelle
text: Chemical firm DuPont bought a specialized manufacturer of medical device parts to grow its high-margin healthcare materials division.

headline: DXC Technology rejects takeover bid
text: IT services firm DXC ended buyout talks with private equity suitors, deciding to pursue a standalone turnaround strategy under new leadership.

headline: Eastman Chemical builds plastic recycling facility in France
text: Materials company Eastman is investing $1 billion in a molecular recycling plant in Normandy to process hard-to-recycle polyester waste.

headline: eBay launches AI-powered 'magical listing' tool
text: E-commerce platform eBay introduced a feature that uses generative AI to write product descriptions from a single photo, speeding up the selling process.

headline: Ecolab raises prices to offset raw material inflation
text: Water and hygiene firm Ecolab successfully implemented price hikes and energy surcharges, restoring margins to pre-pandemic levels.

headline: Edison International settles wildfire claims
text: California utility Southern California Edison (Edison Intl) reached a settlement to resolve remaining lawsuits related to the 2017/2018 wildfires and mudslides.

headline: Elevance Health launches Carelon brand
text: Insurer Anthem rebranded as Elevance Health and consolidated its healthcare services unit under the new name Carelon to simplify its offering.

headline: Emerson Electric completes NI acquisition for $8.2 billion
text: Industrial automation firm Emerson finalized its purchase of National Instruments, expanding its capabilities in software-connected testing and measurement.

headline: Enphase Energy cuts workforce amid solar demand slump
text: Solar inverter maker Enphase announced a 10% layoff, citing high interest rates and regulatory changes in California that dampened rooftop solar sales.

headline: Entergy hardens grid against hurricanes
text: Gulf Coast utility Entergy is spending billions to bury power lines and reinforce poles to prevent outages during future severe storms.

headline: EOG Resources deploys 'super-zipper' fracking tech
text: Oil explorer EOG is using advanced drilling techniques to fracture multiple wells simultaneously, reducing costs and increasing oil recovery rates.

headline: EPAM Systems diversifies delivery centers beyond Eastern Europe
text: IT engineering firm EPAM is rapidly expanding its hubs in India and Latin America to reduce geopolitical risk following the war in Ukraine.

headline: EQT Corp pauses natural gas production due to low prices
text: The largest US natural gas producer EQT announced it is curtailing output until gas prices recover from their current multi-year lows.
